scrub.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to rub something hard, especially with a stiff brush, in order to clean it
scrub.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She was on her hands and knees scrubbing the floor.
He scrubbed the dirt off his boots.
The table needs to be scrubbed clean.
She scrubbed at her face with a tissue.
scrub.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to decide not to do something that you had planned
scrub.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We scrubbed the idea in the end.
scrub.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to remove carbon dioxide from the gas that results from burning coal, before letting it out into the air
scrub.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The liquid is used to scrub carbon dioxide from power plant exhaust gases.
scrub.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: low bushes and trees that grow in very dry soil
scrub.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if you give something a scrub, you clean it by rubbing it hard
scrub.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I gave the floor a good scrub.
